message.content:
cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO 

This paper is about converting artificial neural networks (ANNs) to spiking neural networks (SNNs) for energy-efficient hardware implementation. The paper focuses on image recognition, which falls under computer vision (cs.CV). The conversion method proposed in the paper involves emulating a gate in the ANN with a small circuit of spiking neurons, which is a technique used in neural engineering (cs.NE). The paper also discusses the accuracy and performance of the SNNs, which are topics in machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper mentions the potential for hardware implementation, which is relevant to robotics (cs.RO).
